oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry excerpts - various performances
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpts from a Grand Ole Opry segment from the early 1940s, according to tape case, featuring George D. Hay (host), Uncle Dave Macon (performer), Dorris Macon (performer), Roy Acuff (performer) and his Smoky Mountain Boys (performers), Bashful Brother Oswald (performer) and Rachel Veach (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones -- (01:22) Opening theme -- (01:58) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- (02:16) My Gal Is A Highborn Lady (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) (incomplete) -- (02:50) It Was Sad When That Ship Went Down (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) (incomplete) -- (04:52) The Girl I Love Don't Pay Me No Mind (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) --(06:12) Poultry magazine advertisement (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand Ole Opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Veach, Rachel; Bashful Brother Oswald;
